Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: The Sharpe ratio for the rupiah is the worst in the developing world this month ahead of 3.8 for the Romanian leu and 6.5 for the Czech koruna. In Southeast Asia, the peso and baht are giving the best return figures. The Singapore dollar is providing 7.8 and the ringgit 6.8. The ratio, named after Nobel laureate and Stanford University professor William Sharpe, is a measure of the excess return per unit of risk in holding a currency position. This is used to determine how well an investor is compensated, with a higher ratio translating to more of a reward.
